qas.question: What was designed to standardize the connection of computer peripherals?
USB has become what on other devices?

context: <a0_0>USB<a0_0/> was designed to standardize the connection of computer peripherals (including keyboards, pointing devices, digital cameras, printers, portable media players, disk drives and network adapters) to personal computers, both to communicate and to supply electric power. It has become <a1_0>commonplace<a1_0/> on other devices, such as smartphones, PDAs and video game consoles. USB has effectively replaced <a2_0>a variety of earlier interfaces<a2_0/>, such as serial and parallel ports, as well as separate power chargers for portable devices.
